Ok first of all, women can have af without ovulation, its called annovulatory cycles, most women that have it have PCOS. Oh and the progesterone testing.... I was told anything over 5 is ovulation, but on an unmedicated cycle dr.s want it to be atleast over 10 for  a good quality egg, and over 15 on a medicated cycle (ie clomid, femara, etc.) it took me 4 cycles and adding metformin to get the good numbers 22.2. Its still no indication of pregnancy, but the number does spike after ovulation, and should continue to climb if your are pregnant, because thats what creates a womb to maintain the fetus. If you don't get preg. your body stops production of progesterone and you have af a week later. I'm still so excited mine was that high this month.... can't wait to test :0)

DH was so sweet, he came into the room and even though I yelled at him and said I wanted to be alone he just stayed by my side until I felt better. I'm so blessed. We had a talk after that and he mentioned I needed to slow down and not be so consumed about having a baby, and having it NOW! hehe. He sad he loved me even if we could never have a baby, even though we haven't been trying for that long yet (>1yr). Being reminded of that and that I am loved makes me feel so much better.I'm trying not to work myself up with this being pregnant thing, but I want it so bad. I want to be a mom, I want to know how it feels to have my baby inside me and care for it before it even comes into the world.Needless to say I'll try to relax and trust that God has a time for everything and no matter how much I want something and try to get it, it's still going to happen on HIS time not mine.Lots of baby dust for all of us.. I hope we all get our BFP pretty soon. Just remember to relax and trust always, I think sometimes we get so carried away with our feelings (and messed up hormones/emotions) that we forget what it's all about.

question: Hello everyone I think that this form will be very helpful for all that are on Clomid or that will start Clomid soon.Let me start by saying that I have PCOS and I have 11 year old daughter I have been TTC on and off the last 7 years but since I been married a year ago we been trying faithfully. I was on Clomid in Nov. 2009 I was taking 50mg 3-7cd I was told that I didnt O on this round and that I would need to go up on my next round. Dec came and went no AF so went in to see if I was Pergo but no I was not so they put me on provrea then Clomid on 3-7 100mg. I am now on my 3 and last round of Clomid I am on 150mg 3-7 days and I hope that this time I O because on my last round they told me I O early on cd 15 I have never O in 11 years so that was a good thing. But doc said that the numbers where not where he wanted them to be at so that is why he up my clomid this time.As for side effects on 50mg I had mood swings and hot flashes and the wonderful headaches... On 100mg I thank god I did not have any but did have crazy dreams with them. And with 150mg I had the vision problems. I just hope that this time works.Would love to hear your stories on Clomid and hear how long before you got your BFP on Clomid...
